metadata.description:
Three For The Show - Harry James and His Orchestra
Recorded December 13, 1954 in Hollywood, CA
Released in 1955 on Columbia 40503 and in 1990 on Columbia CK 45447

Written by Jean-Philippe Rameau
Adapted by Harry James
Trumpet, Leader – Harry James
Trumpet – Nick Buono, Art DePew, Ralph Osborn, and Everett McDonald or Conrad Gozzo
Trombone – Lew McCreary, and Carl “Ziggy” Elmer or Dave Robbins
Valve Trombone – Juan Tizol
Alto Saxophone, Clarinet – Willie Smith, Herb Lorden
Tenor Saxophone – Pat Chartrand, William “Jeff” Massingill
Baritone Saxophone – Bob Poland
Piano – Larry Kinnamon or Bruce MacDonald
Guitar – Allen Reuss or Sam Herman
Bass – Theodore “Buddy” Hayes
Drums – Gene Estes or Jackie Mills
Congas – Gordon Polk

Different sources list varying personnel, hence the uncertainty in some of the performer credits.
